headline: Coinbase Posts Mixed Earnings Results That Missed Forecasts. The Stock Is Down.
summary: Crypto investment firm  Coinbase Global  reported mixed results for the first quarter Thursday.  Analysts tracked by FactSet were expecting revenue of $2.1 billion and earnings per share of $1.93.  Shares of  Coinbase  fell 3% in after-hours trading.

headline: Coinbase Q1: It's more about where exchange goes from Deribit deal
summary: Coinbase Global (COIN) missed first quarter estimates on its top and bottom lines amid headlines that it will be acquiring crypto derivatives exchange Deribit in a deal valued at $2.9 billion. Benchmark Company managing director and senior research analyst Mark Palmer weighs in on whether Coinbase's lackluster performance is actually "inconsequentual" in comparison to the Deribit deal. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q1 Earnings
summary: Blockchain infrastructure company Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales rose 24.2% year on year to $2.03 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.94 per share was 1.9% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Coinbase falls shy of Q1 estimates amid bitcoin's recovery
summary: Crypto exchange Coinbase Global (COIN) fell short of first quarter revenue ($2.03 billion vs. expectations of $2.11 billion) and adjusted earnings estimates ($0.24 per share, significantly below Wall Street forecasts). Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton dive into Coinbase's earnings print and its trading volumes on the back of its announced $2.9 billion acquisition of crypto derivatives exchange Deribit. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Coinbase quarterly profit falls as expenses climb, shares down
summary: Total operating expenses soared 51% to $1.3 billion in the quarter, driven by increased marketing expenses as well as losses on crypto assets held for operations, the company said.  U.S. President Donald Trump's erratic trade policy had triggered volatility across asset classes during the first three months of the year, rattling financial markets and triggering a sell-off in assets perceived as risky, such as crypto.  However, its transaction revenue rose 17.3% to $1.26 billion.

headline: Coinbase Stock Climbs Ahead of Earnings. It’s Making a Major Acquisition.
summary: Coinbase  Global, the cryptocurrency asset manager and brokerage, announced a deal on Thursday ahead of its earnings report—a $2.9 billion acquisition of crypto options exchange Deribit.  Shares of  Coinbase  rose nearly 5% on the deal.  Coinbase has also been whipsawed by the volatility in stocks and cryptocurrencies.

headline: Coinbase to expand its derivatives offering with $2.9B acquisition of Deribit
summary: Investing.com -- Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN), one of the world’s leading crypto platforms, has announced a deal to acquire Deribit, the world’s top crypto options exchange with approximately $30 billion in current open interest. This strategic acquisition is expected to significantly advance Coinbase’s derivatives business, positioning the company as a leading global platform for crypto derivatives.

raw.headline: Coinbase to expand its derivatives offering with $2.9B acquisition of Deribit

This strategic acquisition is expected to significantly advance Coinbase’s derivatives business, positioning the company as a leading global platform for crypto derivatives.

headline: In $2.9B Deal, Coinbase Buys Deribit to Expand in U.S. Crypto Options Market
summary: The deal includes $700 million in cash and 11 million shares of Coinbase Class A common stock.

raw.headline: In $2.9B Deal, Coinbase Buys Deribit to Expand in U.S. Crypto Options Market

headline: Coinbase buys Deribit in $2.9 billion deal to expand crypto options base
summary: (Reuters) -Coinbase, the largest publicly traded cryptocurrency exchange, said on Thursday it will buy derivatives exchange Deribit in a $2.9 billion deal to expand into the crypto options markets.  The move underscores a push by crypto firms to widen their  institutional investor base, while also catering to retail traders who are becoming more sophisticated.  The Deribit acquisition gives Coinbase "a foothold in non-U.S. markets, especially Asia and Europe, where leverage trading is more prevalent," said Bo Pei, analyst at US Tiger Securities.

raw.headline: Coinbase buys Deribit in $2.9 billion deal to expand crypto options base
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Coinbase, the largest publicly traded cryptocurrency exchange, said on Thursday it will buy derivatives exchange Deribit in a $2.9 billion deal to expand into the crypto options markets.  The move underscores a push by crypto firms to widen their  institutional investor base, while also catering to retail traders who are becoming more sophisticated.  The Deribit acquisition gives Coinbase "a foothold in non-U.S. markets, especially Asia and Europe, where leverage trading is more prevalent," said Bo Pei, analyst at US Tiger Securities.
